briefTitle: Effects of Exenatide Long-Acting Release on Glucose Control and Safety in Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus(DURATION - 1)

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in HbA1c From Baseline to Week 30
outcomeMeasures.description: Absolute change in HbA1c from Baseline (Day -3) to Week 30 \[Week 30 - Baseline\]

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in HbA1c From Baseline to Week 364
outcomeMeasures.description: Absolute change in HbA1c from Baseline (Day -3) to Week 364

outcomeMeasures.title: Sub-study Relative Bioavailability of Exenatide When Administered Using the Exenatide Once Weekly Dual Chambered Pen and the Exenatide Once Weekly Single Dose Tray (Single Dose Tray-11 Weekly Doses Switch to Dual Chamber Pen-11 Weekly Dose)
outcomeMeasures.description: Measure by Geometric mean ratio (GMR) of plasma exenatide average steady state concentration Css,avg at Visit 11-14 to Visit 24-27 with 90% confidence interval

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Subjects Achieving HbA1c Target of <7%
outcomeMeasures.description: Percentage of subjects achieving HbA1c target value of \<7% at Week 30.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Subjects Achieving HbA1c Target of <7%
outcomeMeasures.description: Percentages of subjects achieving HbA1c target value of \<7% at Week 364

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Subjects Achieving HbA1c Target of <=6.5%
outcomeMeasures.description: Percentages of subjects achieving HbA1c target values of \<=6.5% at Week 30.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Subjects Achieving HbA1c Target of <=6.5%
outcomeMeasures.description: Percentages of subjects achieving HbA1c target values of \<=6.5% at Week 364

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Subjects Achieving HbA1c Target of <=6.0%
outcomeMeasures.description: Percentage of subjects achieving HbA1c target values of \<=6.0% at Week 30.

outcomeMeasures.title: Exenatide LAR Steady State Concentration From Week 29 to Week 30
outcomeMeasures.description: Steady-state plasma exenatide concentration over the dosing interval of Week 29 to Week 30 (0-168 hours) was evaluated. Geometric mean for the average steady-state concentration and its 10th and 90th percentiles were reported.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in 2 Hours (2h) Postprandial Glucose From Baseline to Week 14
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in 2h Postprandial Glucose from baseline (Day -3) to Week 14

outcomeMeasures.title: Sub-study Safety and Tolerability of Exenatide When Administered Using the Once Weekly Single Dose Tray and the Once Weekly Dual (Single Dose Tray-11 Weekly Doses Switch to Dual Chamber Pen-11 Weekly Dose)
outcomeMeasures.description: Measure by geometric mean ratio of the maximum steady state plasma exenatide concentration Css, max at Visit 11-14 to Visit 24-27 with 90% confidence interval and incidence of treatment-emergent injection site adverse events.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Body Weight From Baseline to Week 30
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in body weight from baseline (Day -3) to Week 30

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Body Weight From Baseline to Week 364
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in body weight from baseline (Day -3) to Week 364

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Fasting Plasma Glucose From Baseline to Week 30
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in fasting plasma glucose from baseline (Day -3) to Week 30.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Fasting Plasma Glucose From Baseline to Week 364
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in fasting plasma glucose from baseline (Day -3) to Week 364.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Blood Pressure From Baseline to Week 30
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in Sitting Diastolic Blood Pressure and Sitting Systolic Blood Pressure from baseline to Week 30

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Blood Pressure From Baseline to Week 364
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in Sitting Diastolic Blood Pressure and Sitting Systolic Blood Pressure from baseline to Week 364

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Total Cholesterol From Baseline to Week 30
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in total cholesterol from baseline (Day -3) to Week 30.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Total Cholesterol From Baseline to Week 364
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in total cholesterol from baseline (Day -3) to Week 364.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in High-density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (HDL-C) From Baseline to Week 30
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C) from baseline (Day -3) to Week 30.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in High-density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (HDL-C) From Baseline to Week 364
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C) from baseline (Day -3) to Week 364.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Low-density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (LDL-C) From Baseline to Week 364
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) from baseline (Day -3) to Week 364.

outcomeMeasures.title: Ratio of Triglycerides at Week 30 to Baseline
outcomeMeasures.description: Ratio of triglycerides (measured in mg/dL) at Week 30 to baseline (Day -3). Log (Postbaseline Triglycerides) - log (Baseline Triglycerides); change from baseline to endpoint is presented as ratio of endpoint to baseline.

outcomeMeasures.title: Ratio of Triglycerides at Week 364 to Baseline
outcomeMeasures.description: Ratio of triglycerides (measured in mg/dL) at Week 364 to baseline (Day -3). Log (Postbaseline Triglycerides) - log (Baseline Triglycerides); change from baseline to endpoint is presented as ratio of endpoint to baseline.

outcomeMeasures.title: Assessment on Event Rate of Treatment-emergent Hypoglycemic Events With SU Use at Screening
outcomeMeasures.description: The major hypoglycemia category included events that, in the judgment of the investigator or physician, resulted in loss of consciousness, seizure, coma, or other change in mental status consistent with neuroglycopenia, in which symptoms resolved after administration of intramuscular glucagon or intravenous glucose, required third-party assistance, and was accompanied by a blood glucose concentration of less than 54 mg/dL prior to treatment, whether or not symptoms of hypoglycemia were perceived by the subject. The minor hypoglycemia were accompanied by a blood glucose concentration of less than 54 mg/dL prior to treatment and not classified as major hypoglycemia.

outcomeMeasures.title: Assessment on Event Rate of Treatment-emergent Hypoglycemic Events With Non-SU Use at Screening
outcomeMeasures.description: The major hypoglycemia category included events that, in the judgment of the investigator or physician, resulted in loss of consciousness, seizure, coma, or other change in mental status consistent with neuroglycopenia, in which symptoms resolved after administration of intramuscular glucagon or intravenous glucose, required third-party assistance, and was accompanied by a blood glucose concentration of less than 54 mg/dL prior to treatment, whether or not symptoms of hypoglycemia were perceived by the subject. The minor hypoglycemia were accompanied by a blood glucose concentration of less than 54 mg/dL prior to treatment and not classified as major hypoglycemia.
